720938f-a.text:
Lexington Avenue, south from East 27th Street. On the right are row buildings extending to 26th St., below which appears the 69th Regiment Armory. This occupies the 26th - 25th Street frontage.
April 13, 1924
Standard Photographic Service
Gift of Borough President of Manhattan

711857f-a.text:
27th Street at N. E. corner of Lexington Avenue, showing the
Armenian bookstore of H. Mamasian.
February 23, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

720936f-a.text:
100-106 Lexington Avenue, at and adjoining the N.W. corner of 27th Street. No. 104 replaced a brownstone-front house similar
to No. 102.
February 23, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

711855f-b.text:
(1)
Branhall Theatre, 138 East 27th Street, aojoining the S.E. corner of Lexington Avenue. This theatre was created in 1915 by remodelling the ground floor of an old tenement house, and is one of New York's smallest theatres. It is now known as the Davenport or Free Theatre. There is no admission change, but a collection is taken at the conclusion of a performance.
August 2, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, with the theatre's name changed to Davenport, or
Free Theatre.
February 23, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
